wikipedia_page.main: Albert McCann (1 November 1941 – 9 January 2014) was an English footballer who played as a midfielder, winger or forward.McCann began his career with Luton Town but made only 6 league appearances before joining Coventry City (22 League appearances). He moved to Portsmouth in 1962 and would enjoy a 12-year stay at the club, becoming a fan favourite and a regular scorer and creator of goals on the wings, in midfield or up front. He was inducted into the club's "Hall of Fame" in March 2011.
